job_title: Intensive Care Unit Nurse (ICU Nurse) in Jacksonville, FL

pros:
Caring staff
Great place to get emergency/critical care experience
cons: Terrible management. They do not care about the staff or patients, only money. Turnover is incredibly high, you deal with high volume with short staff daily. Suggestions and requests for help go ignored by management. For these reasons, trust among employees toward management is exceedingly low. This is a chronic, senior management issue, I've witnessed it between the years of 2013-2020 with different department managers.

review_title: Great company to work, friendly coworkers, challenging to get promoted if your position is staff-level
pros:
- Annual benefit of $400 (to be used for healthcare expenses like medications, co-pays,etc.) given for being healthy and not smoking
- Friendly, knowledgeable coworkers (you will love the people you work with)
- Culture is pretty positive
- Very flexible schedules (work/life balance is great)
cons:
- Advancing is pretty difficult unless you're already in a mid-level to higher-ranked management position, i.e. almost all of the administrative staff has been promoted within the corporation, however anyone below management level has been in the same position for years regardless of working long hours, saving on bottom-line, increasing efficiency in developmental processes, etc.
- Pay stays pretty much the same (due to the difficulty of advancement)

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros: Teamwork of RN’s and direct patient care team.
cons:
RN responsible for housekeeping duties and reprimanded of not done while housekeeping stood around in hallways with their carts on their phones. Patient rooms and bathrooms were not being cleaned for days. 
Often short on supplies to perform adequate patient care. Much broken equipment preventing me from doing my job in a timely manner. Ultimately patient care suffered from a lack of adequate resources and staffing.

pros:
Nursing is needed in order to work full time in emergency service.
Salary $ 45.000 per year
cons:
Responsabilities: 
You must order patients entry cardex.
You must deliver medicines to patients at the times ordened by the treating medic.
You must collect blood samples and others ordered in the medical history
You must have responsability for patients and protecting them of in-hospital injuries.
You mustmake a correct and clear turn delivery, reporting the news.

Do not walk but RUN !!!!! away from this hospital , saying goodbye to 5 coworkers this month,people scattering like cockroaches !!! It's so sad to see a once wonderful place to work, To have money and metric motives their only concern,and will run over anyone to get it!
